description: Faced with spreading unrest and growing Council chaos, Oksana Lintz submits a sharply-worded report to the Directorate, recommending immediate restoration of BCI enforcement and emergency powers to prevent citywide collapse. She acknowledges risks but warns that inaction could result in uncontrollable disorder.

The Directorate adopts Oksana's recommendation and moves swiftly to regain control. Emergency protocols are activated: all dissent organizers and outspoken critics within government ranks are flagged for detention. High-profile operations are coordinated for maximum impact.

In a coordinated citywide operation, Directorate security teams detain protest leaders and Council opponents. BCI scoring thresholds are tightened, causing sudden travel bans, service denials, and public blacklists for flagged citizens. Propaganda broadcasts declare compliance and order restored.
Despite intense crackdown, citizens adapt again—bypassing BCI checkpoints with analog sabotage, graffiti, and makeshift badges. Resistance quietly spreads, aided by a few sympathetic Council members.

Council infighting erupts as pro-civilian and Directorate loyalists blame each other for abuses and hardship. Public demonstrations outside Council chambers swell in size, demanding an end to the harsh measures and real reform.
